venue.name: Wishcamper Center at USM Portland Room 102

item.description:
Please consider joining our friends at the New England Environmental Finance Center for this half-day event.

------------------------------

Friday, February 24, 2012 from 7:30 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. Registration, coffee & refreshments at 7:30. Presentation begins at 8:00 a.m. Free parking in adjacent garage on Bedford Street ||  Event is free and open to the public

 


Sea level rise adaptation planning is underway in Portland. The Environmental Finance Center (EFC) at the Muskie School of Public Service, University of Southern Maine is hosting a public discussion about results from a simulation modeling effort in support of this process.

 

The EFC will present results from a recent study using their COAST tool (Coastal Adaptation to Sea level rise Tool), which helps communities evaluate costs and benefits of adaptation actions municipalities might undertake in response to threats of sea level rise and storm surge over the next century. The study evaluated potential lost real estate values in the Bayside portion of Portland, under different sea level rise, storm surge, and adaptation scenarios.

Through 3D visualizations, tallies of expected damages, and a presentation describing these results, the EFC is encouraging interested stakeholders in Portland to become involved in a larger, upcoming adaptation planning process for the city. Breakout discussions at this meeting will provide opportunities for input about adaptation actions the city might undertake, and help frame the planning process going forward.

RSVP: sadie.lloyd@maine.edu

Agenda for the day 7:30 – 8:00 Registration, coffee, refreshments   8:00 – 9:00 Welcome Mayor Michael Brennan   Goals for the morning Sam Merrill, EFC   Climate change and sea level rise overview     Summary of recent simulation work in Back Cove Peter Slovinksy, Maine Geologic Survey   Overview of the COAST process and how Portland can use it Sam Merrill 9:00 – 9:20 Description of map and table results on the walls   9:20 –9:30 Silent observation/absorption of map and table results; move to breakout rooms   9:35 – 11:10 Four breakout groups, on 3 questions; return to main room (102)   11:15 – 11:55 Report outs, discussion   11:55 – 12:00 Summary observations, integration, next steps Sam Merrill

 

 

This event is hosted by the Environmental Finance Center and co-sponsored by the Portland Society of Architects.
item.how_to_find_us: Parking (Free) is in the garage attached to the building next door to Wishcamper

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Sea Level Rise Planning for Bayside in Portland: A Community Discussion
